p: The phenolic compounds that exist in fruits have low potency, which is responsible for various beneficial activities like antioxidant and anti-inflammatory activities. These phenolic functional groups share their electron pair or hydrogen with the ROS (reactive oxygen species) to scavenge them ( Baba and Malik, 2015). These phytochemicals mainly exist in polymeric forms bound to the cell wall, during different drying operations the heat flux generated, which may incur the breakdown of the polymeric linkage and leading to the development of the antioxidant of lower molecular weight ( Lee et al., 2017).
